comments.body: Every BECOME_METHOD except runas has a BECOME_ERROR_STRINGS and BECOME_MISSING_STRINGS.  Is it expected to exist for 'runas', too?
Yes, runas is different from most of the other become methods. If you are having an issue with it, please raise a GH issue with the details.

comments.body:
why dict(k=v) instead of {k:v}? Is it faster? more readable? policy? better for python3? something else?
_ah. I see that this is just a move from play_context.py - I'm still curious about the difference in syntax. Do you know why?_
i just copied, didn't reformat , {} is actually slightly faster than dict() ... but not an optimization i'm going to do here as my hope is to remove this whole mapping in the end.
